title: Problem Overview
content:
**Erdős Problem #441: LCM-Bounded Subsets**

Find the maximum size g(N) of A ⊆ {1,...,N} such that lcm(a,b) ≤ N for all a,b ∈ A.

**Question:** Is Erdős' construction optimal?

**Answer:** NO (Chen-Dai, 2006)

The asymptotic is g(N) ~ (9N/8)^{1/2}, but the proposed construction is not always optimal.
mathContext: LCM constraints arise in number theory when studying multiplicative structure. The constraint lcm(a,b) ≤ N restricts which pairs can coexist in A.

title: IsLCMBounded
content:
**LCM-Bounded Subset:**

A ⊆ {1,...,N} is LCM-bounded if:
1. A ⊆ {1,...,N} (elements in range)
2. lcm(a,b) ≤ N for all a,b ∈ A

This restricts which pairs can coexist - elements with many common factors work well together.

title: g(N) - Maximum Size
content:
**g(N) = max{|A| : A is LCM-bounded in {1,...,N}}**

This is the central quantity. Erdős' question asks for its exact value and whether his construction achieves it.

title: Erdős' Construction
content:
**Erdős' Proposed Construction:**

1. All integers in [1, (N/2)^{1/2}]
2. All EVEN integers in [(N/2)^{1/2}, (2N)^{1/2}]

**Why it works:** Small integers have small LCMs with each other. Even integers in the second range have LCMs bounded by their product of 2, which stays ≤ N.

title: ErdosQuestion
content:
**The Main Question:**

Is g(N) = |ErdosConstruction(N)| for all N ≥ 1?

Does Erdős' construction always achieve the maximum?

title: Chen's Asymptotic (1998)
content:
**Chen's Theorem:**

g(N) ~ (9N/8)^{1/2} as N → ∞

This establishes the asymptotic behavior - the construction gives the right order of magnitude.

title: Chen-Dai Upper Bound (2007)
content:
**Chen-Dai Upper Bound:**

g(N) ≤ (9N/8)^{1/2} + O((N/log N)^{1/2} · log log N)

The error term is larger than O(1), leaving room for the construction to be suboptimal.

title: Construction Not Optimal (Chen-Dai 2006)
content:
**Chen-Dai (2006):**

For infinitely many N: g(N) > |ErdosConstruction(N)|

This definitively answers Erdős' question: NO, the construction is not always optimal.

title: erdos_question_disproved
content:
**Erdős' Question is Disproved:**

If the construction is not optimal for infinitely many N, then it cannot be optimal for ALL N.

The proof uses basic logic: existence of counterexamples contradicts universal optimality.

title: Why 9/8?
content:
**Origin of the constant 9/8:**

From Erdős' construction:
- First part: ~(N/2)^{1/2} integers
- Second part: ~(1/2)[(2N)^{1/2} - (N/2)^{1/2}] even integers

Total ≈ (3/(2√2)) · N^{1/2} = (9/8)^{1/2} · N^{1/2}

title: Summary
content:
**Erdős Problem #441: SOLVED**

**Question:** Is Erdős' construction optimal for g(N)?

**Answer:** NO

**Results:**
- Asymptotic: g(N) ~ (9N/8)^{1/2} (Chen 1998)
- Upper: g(N) ≤ (9N/8)^{1/2} + O((N/log N)^{1/2} log log N)
- The construction is NOT optimal for infinitely many N (Chen-Dai 2006)

**Key insight:** Even asymptotically optimal constructions may not be exactly optimal.
